name: Muslim Wellness Foundation
mission: Muslim Wellness Foundation (MWF) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to promoting healing and well-being in American Muslim communities through dialogue, education and training. The MWF approach to health is interdisciplinary, intergenerational, spiritually grounded, community based, and justice-oriented. From being the first Muslim organization in the country to offer Mental Health First Aid (MHFA) trainings to establishing the annual Black Muslim Psychology Conference (BMPC), MWF has been an outspoken leader in fostering visions for wellness and healing. Our programs demonstrate our keen awareness of the link between oppression, wellness and how communities heal, grow, thrive, and experience joy in the midst of it all. We will continue to lead the way in shifting the conversation on mental health, addiction and trauma - from one narrowly focused on stigma to a healing-centered model of collective well-being, faith, identity and belonging. Join us on this journey.
theoryOfChange: The MWF approach to health is interdisciplinary, intergenerational, spiritually grounded, community based, and justice-oriented, aiming to shift from stigma-focused models to healing-centered models of collective well-being.

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="3">100.0% of its total expenses</cite> toward its programs and services, far exceeding the industry standard of 75%.
MWF spends <cite id="6">$0.00 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions, maximizing the impact of every dollar donated.
The foundation has achieved a <cite id="7">3-year revenue CAGR of 49.6%</cite>, indicating significant growth in community support.

strengths_deep_dive: The Muslim Wellness Foundation distinguishes itself through a highly focused delivery model centered on capacity building. By facilitating <cite id="4">Mental Health First Aid trainings</cite>, the organization empowers community members to act as first responders to emotional crises. Furthermore, its <cite id="5">Black Muslim Psychology Conference</cite> provides a unique platform for addressing the specific mental health needs of an underserved demographic within the broader Muslim community. This specialized focus allows the organization to maintain <cite id="3">zero administrative or fundraising overhead</cite> according to its most recent financial filings, a rare feat that ensures direct service delivery.
rich_narrative.summary: The Muslim Wellness Foundation (MWF) is a specialized nonprofit organization dedicated to <cite id="1">promoting healing and emotional well-being</cite> within the American Muslim community. Operating with a focus on the intersection of faith, race, and mental health, the organization addresses systemic gaps in psychological support through community-based initiatives. In the 2023 tax year, the foundation reported <cite id="2">total revenue of $223,205</cite>, reflecting its status as an emerging institution in the domestic wellness space. Despite its modest scale, the organization demonstrates exceptional fiscal leanliness, maintaining a <cite id="3">100.0% program expense ratio</cite>, which ensures that all contributions are directed toward its core mission. Key programming includes <cite id="4">Mental Health First Aid (MHFA) trainings</cite> and the <cite id="5">Black Muslim Psychology Conference (BMPC)</cite>, both of which aim to build capacity within the community to recognize and respond to mental health challenges. The organization operates with <cite id="6">high fundraising efficiency</cite>, spending $0.00 to raise every $1, allowing donor funds to be utilized entirely for service delivery rather than administrative overhead.
